com.camerontec.util.jmx.cascading.agent

Class CascadingAgent

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.util.jmx.cascading.agent.CascadingAgent

  • public final class CascadingAgent
extends Object
    This is a rewrite of the OpenDMK's CascadingService which addresses its scalability issues whilst preserving its behaviour.

    The Cascading Agent makes it possible to mount a partial view of a source MBeanServer known by its JMXServiceURL into a target MBeanServer. This implementation differs from the OpenDMK's CascadingService in the following ways:
    • The CascadingAgent is not an MBean.
    • It is possible to be notified of cascading failures by registering a CascadingFailureListener.
    • There is no support for unmounting notifications.
    • Proxy MBeans that get registered in the target MBean server cache their MBean info locally for as long as they remain registered. This means that remote MBeans are not expected to change their MBean info whilst registered.
    • When registering a notification listener with a cascaded MBean, the provided notification filter does not get passed to the server. Instead, all notifications are passed through to cascaded MBeans and filtered on the client. This implementation makes it possible to register notification listeners for a large number of cascaded MBeans at low cost. The down side is that if a large number of notifications is emitted by cascaded MBeans but few are actually of interest, network usage is not optimal.
    In order to achieve best performance, in particular in situations where a large number of MBeans are cascaded over a network link with a high RTT, this implementation relies on the JMX connector server it connects to to make use of a CascadingMBeanServerForwarder instance. In the absence of a CascadingMBeanServerForwarder on the server side, full functionality is retained but performance is in the same ballpark as that of the JDMK's Cascading Service.

    • Method Detail

      • mount

        public String mount(JMXServiceURL sourceURL,
                    Map<String,?> sourceConnectionParameters,
                    ObjectName sourcePattern,
                    String targetPath)
             throws IOException,
                    InstanceAlreadyExistsException
        Mounts a partial view of a source MBeanServer identified by its JMXServiceURL.
        This method obtains a JMXConnector by calling JMXConnectorFactory.connect(JMXServiceURL, Map). It then mounts the source MBeanServer under the provided target path into the agent's target MBeanServer.
        Only the source MBeans whose source ObjectName satisfy the provided pattern will be mounted.
        Parameters:
        sourceURL - A JMXServiceURL from which a JMXConnector to the source MBeanServer can be obtained. Cannot be null.
        sourceConnectionParameters - A map that gets passed to JMXConnectorFactory.connect(JMXServiceURL,Map) in order to connect to the source MBeanServer.
        sourcePattern - An ObjectName pattern that must be satisfied by the names of the source MBeans. Only those MBeans that satisfy the pattern will be mounted. A null value is equivalent to the wildcard *:* pattern.
        targetPath - The path under which the source MBeans will be mounted into the target MBeanServer. All source MBean names will be transformed in the target MBeanServer by prefixing their domain name with that target path. An MBean whose name is D:k1=v1,k2=v2 will thus be mounted as <targetPath>/D:k1=v1,k2=v2.

        MBeans from different sources should not be mounted under the same target path. Moreover, an application should not attempt to mount source MBeans under a target path that already contain MBeans in the target MBeanServer.

        This target path cannot be null or empty.

        Returns:
        A mount point ID, identifying this mount operation. This mount point ID must be later used to call unmount(java.lang.String).
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If either the source URL or target path is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - If either of the following happens:
        • The target path is empty.
        • There is already a mount point for the given combination of source URL, source pattern and target path.
        IOException - If the connector client or the connection to the source MBeanServer cannot be made.
        SecurityException - If the connection with the source MBeanServer cannot be made for security reasons.
        InstanceAlreadyExistsException - If a name conflict is detected while performing the mount operation.

      • unmount

        public void unmount(String mountPointID)
             throws IOException
        Undo the mount operation identified by the given mount point ID, which must be a mount point ID obtained from calling mount.
        Parameters:
        mountPointID - A mount point ID previously obtained from calling mount. Cannot be null.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the supplied mount point ID is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - If the supplied mount point ID is not a known mount point ID.
        IOException - If the connection with the source MBeanServer cannot be closed cleanly.

      • addCascadingFailureListener

        public void addCascadingFailureListener(CascadingFailureListener listener)
        Registers a listener to be notified of cascading failures. If the JMX Connection with a source MBeanServer fails or is permanently closed, all registered listeners will get notified via their CascadingFailureListener.cascadingFailed(java.lang.String, java.lang.String) method.
        Parameters:
        listener - A CascadingFailureListener. Cannot be null.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the supplied listener is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - If the supplied listener is already registered.

      • removeCascadingFailureListener

        public void removeCascadingFailureListener(CascadingFailureListener listener)
        Unregisters a CascadingFailureListener.
        Parameters:
        listener - A CascadingFailureListener. Cannot be null.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the supplied listener is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - If the supplied listener is not registered.
